name: I thought love came in all colors, but sometimes i feel like i'm fading
description:
That night I wanted to invite you to dinner, hoping to have you all night, until sunrise, so that I could prepare you coffee in the morning.

Maybe you would bring a dry red wine or a rosé to harmonize with our dinner.

I would light a lemon grass or aniseed candle. I never know which one to choose, both remind me of the color of your eyes.

I am a terrible plant mother, but I am sure that all my flowers would open for you. Even the ones I cultivate in secret places on my body.

That night I wanted to invite you to dinner, but you couldn't. Too much work, too tired.

I thought of inviting you for an afternoon coffee and then maybe you would stay for dinner. You couldn't do it either. 

Too much work, too tired.

The night came and I didn't even want to bother inviting you anymore. I got tired of waiting for someone who will never arrive.

I opened some wine, sat down with my good old loneliness, and must have fallen asleep in some chapter of my book.

I woke up and made myself some tea, the idea of coffee seemed too bitter.
